As they reluctantly reunite over the years to honor Josh's memory, their animosity gradually fades, suggesting that Josh may have orchestrated this reunion from beyond the grave.
The story is beautifully crafted, infused with a delightful touch of humor.

A must-read for anyone who has experienced grief or seeks to understand a grieving loved one. This beautifully crafted story explores hope and new beginnings after heartbreak and loss, all while incorporating a touch of humor.
I picked up this book solely for its amusing title and cover, and I was completely blown away. I devoured it and didn't want it to end!
conclusion: This novel is a heartfelt and engaging exploration of grief, healing, and second chances. The emotional depth, relatable characters, and well-balanced humor make it a memorable read. It’s a story that resonates deeply, especially for those who have experienced loss or want to understand the grieving process.

review: The story begins with Maddie Sanderson at her brother's funeral, where she seeks refuge in a broom closet, absorbed in her laptop. The loss of her brother Josh to cancer weighs heavily on her. In an unexpected encounter, her former boyfriend, Dominic Perry—who was also Josh's best friend—finds her. In his will, Josh has entrusted Maddie and Dominic with the poignant task of scattering his ashes in eight meaningful locations around the world, each significant to him as a nature photographer.

Maddie and Dominic share a complicated past. When Maddie was just 18, Dom broke her heart by marrying someone else, Rosalie. Despite this, they spend over a year traveling together, opening envelopes containing Josh's farewell messages at each location. During their journey, they rekindle their love. It becomes clear that Dom has always loved Maddie, but he married Rosalie out of obligation due to her pregnancy. Tragically, Rosalie lost the baby shortly after their marriage, leading to their separation before Josh's funeral.
While I'm not typically a fan of romance, this book truly resonated with me. It masterfully evoked strong emotions, making it a perfect read.
conclusion: This was a deeply emotional and engaging novel that blended romance, grief, and self-discovery. review: The plot centers on Maddie and Dom, whose strained relationship stems from a one-night stand and years of estrangement. Josh, a pivotal character, orchestrates their reunion through a series of letters during his funeral, leading them on an adventure across various states. The well-executed time skips, covering two years with seasonal meetings, enhance the narrative. Told from Maddie’s perspective, the story initially limits insight into Dom’s thoughts and feelings, only revealing them in the second half. A dual POV could have offered a more balanced and nuanced conclusion.

Maddie and Dom experience substantial growth throughout the novel, particularly during the time skips. Although Josh is deceased, he serves as the emotional core of the story, with his memory and the characters' shared experiences ensuring his presence endures.

This book thoughtfully examines themes of loss, grief, and the importance of cherishing loved ones as we move forward. It also touches on second-chance romance, though the resolution of this relationship could have benefited from improved communication between the characters.

The journey through the letters is both heartwarming and heartbreaking, evoking deep emotions. Josh's reminiscences and the characters' shared history enrich the narrative, adding depth and resonance.
conclusion: This contemporary romance novel delivers a heartfelt story of love, loss, and second chances, with a unique plot structure and strong emotional impact. While the romance could have been more developed with better communication and a dual POV, the character growth and thematic depth make it a memorable read.

review: I will never forgive Dom for marrying Rosaline. Throughout the story, Maddie pines for him while engaging in non-serious relationships, while Dom enters a loveless marriage. His actions are frustrating—he gets engaged the day after a hookup with someone he claims to love because she’s pregnant, then remains in that marriage for over six years, all while insisting that Maddie is the only one he sees. The twist at the end, revealing that Rosaline and Josh are in love, is irritating. If they truly loved each other, they should have chosen their real partners. I also disliked how Maddie was always the one to make the first move, especially after Dom's betrayal. Once their animosity faded, their relationship devolved into mere physical intimacy, with little meaningful conversation until the very end. If Dom truly loved Maddie, he should have been more romantic and proactive in their relationship.

This beautifully written book is a true page-turner. The author masterfully evokes a deep affection for Josh, even in his absence, making him feel like a character you wish you had known. The Perry twins also stand out as a highlight, adding depth and intrigue to the story.
conclusion: While the book was well-written and engaging, the frustrating character decisions and romantic dynamics significantly impacted my enjoyment. Dom’s actions and the lack of meaningful communication between the main characters were particularly disappointing. However, the author excelled in creating memorable side characters like Josh and the Perry twins.

  I will never forgive Dom for marrying Rosaline. The heroine, Maddie, was always pining and in non-serious relationships while the hero, Dom, got to be married. Dom’s actions were frustrating—getting engaged the next day after hooking up with someone he supposedly loved because she was pregnant, then staying in a loveless marriage for 6+ years while claiming Maddie was "all he could see." **Conclusion:**  
While the book was well-written and engaging, the frustrating character decisions and romantic dynamics significantly impacted my enjoyment. However, the author excelled in creating memorable side characters like Josh and the Perry twins.
